verses.text_plain: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.
verses.verse_html: 1Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.

verses.text_plain: Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned: for she hath received of the Lord’s hand double for all her sins.
verses.verse_html:
2Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned: for she hath received of the Lord’s hand double for all her sins. ▼
▼ comfortably: Heb. to the heart
 , ▼
▼ warfare: or, appointed time

footnotes.body_html: ▼ comfortably: Heb. to the heart
▼ warfare: or, appointed time

verses.text_plain: The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.
verses.verse_html: 3The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.

verses.text_plain: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places plain:
verses.verse_html:
4Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough places plain: ▼
▼ straight: or, a straight place
 , ▼
▼ plain: or, a plain place

footnotes.body_html: ▼ straight: or, a straight place
▼ plain: or, a plain place

verses.text_plain: And the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
verses.verse_html: 5And the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

verses.text_plain: The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field:
verses.verse_html: 6The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field:

verses.text_plain: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the spirit of the Lord bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.
verses.verse_html: 7The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the spirit of the Lord bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.

verses.text_plain: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
verses.verse_html: 8The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.

verses.text_plain: O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God!
verses.verse_html:
9O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God! ▼
▼ O Zion…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion
 , ▼
▼ O Jerusalem…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem

footnotes.body_text: ▼ O Zion…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion
footnotes.body_html: ▼ O Zion…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion

footnotes.body_text: ▼ O Jerusalem…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem
footnotes.body_html: ▼ O Jerusalem…: or, O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem

verses.text_plain: Behold, the Lord God will come with strong hand, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
verses.verse_html:
10Behold, the Lord God will come with strong hand, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him. ▼
▼ with strong…: or, against the strong
 , ▼
▼ his work: or, recompence for his work

footnotes.body_text: ▼ with strong…: or, against the strong
footnotes.body_html: ▼ with strong…: or, against the strong

footnotes.body_text: ▼ his work: or, recompence for his work
footnotes.body_html: ▼ his work: or, recompence for his work

verses.text_plain: He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young.
verses.verse_html:
11He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young. ▼
▼ that…: or, that give suck

footnotes.body_html: ▼ that…: or, that give suck

verses.text_plain: Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance?
verses.verse_html:
12Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance? ▼
▼ a measure: Heb. a tierce

tokens.text: in the hollow of his hand

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a measure: Heb. a tierce

verses.text_plain: Who hath directed the Spirit of the Lord, or being his counsellor hath taught him?
verses.verse_html:
13Who hath directed the Spirit of the Lord, or being his counsellor hath taught him? ▼
▼ his…: Heb. man of his counsel

footnotes.body_text: ▼ his…: Heb. man of his counsel
footnotes.body_html: ▼ his…: Heb. man of his counsel

verses.text_plain: With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him the way of understanding?
verses.verse_html:
14With whom took he counsel, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him knowledge, and shewed to him the way of understanding? ▼
▼ instructed…: Heb. made him understand
 , ▼
▼ understanding: Heb. understandings?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ instructed…: Heb. made him understand

verses.text_plain: Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance: behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.
verses.verse_html: 15Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance: behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.

verses.text_plain: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
verses.verse_html: 16And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.

verses.text_plain: All nations before him are as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity.
verses.verse_html: 17All nations before him are as nothing; and they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity.

tokens.text: as nothing; and they are counted

verses.text_plain: To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?
verses.verse_html: 18To whom then will ye liken God? or what likeness will ye compare unto him?

tokens.text: To whom then will ye liken

verses.text_plain: The workman melteth a graven image, and the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains.
verses.verse_html: 19The workman melteth a graven image, and the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains.

verses.text_plain: He that is so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image, that shall not be moved.
verses.verse_html:
20He that is so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cunning workman to prepare a graven image, that shall not be moved. ▼
▼ is so…: Heb. is poor of oblation

footnotes.body_text: ▼ is so…: Heb. is poor of oblation
footnotes.body_html: ▼ is so…: Heb. is poor of oblation

verses.text_plain: Have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you from the beginning? have ye not understood from the foundations of the earth?
verses.verse_html: 21Have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you from the beginning? have ye not understood from the foundations of the earth?

verses.text_plain: It is he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in:
verses.verse_html:
22It is he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in: ▼
▼ It is…: or, Him that

footnotes.body_html: ▼ It is…: or, Him that

verses.text_plain: That bringeth the princes to nothing; he maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.
verses.verse_html: 23That bringeth the princes to nothing; he maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.

verses.text_plain: Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.
verses.verse_html: 24Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.

tokens.text: Yea, they shall not be planted
yea, they shall not be sown
upon them, and they shall wither

verses.text_plain: To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.
verses.verse_html: 25To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.

tokens.text: To whom then will ye liken
me, or shall I be equal

verses.text_plain: Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might, for that he is strong in power; not one faileth.
verses.verse_html: 26Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by names by the greatness of his might, for that he is strong in power; not one faileth.

verses.text_plain: Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from the Lord, and my judgment is passed over from my God?
verses.verse_html: 27Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from the Lord, and my judgment is passed over from my God?

verses.text_plain: Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, that the everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? there is no searching of his understanding.
verses.verse_html: 28Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, that the everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? there is no searching of his understanding.

verses.text_plain: He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
verses.verse_html: 29He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.

verses.text_plain: Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:
verses.verse_html: 30Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:

verses.text_plain: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.verse_html:
31But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint. ▼
▼ renew: Heb. change
